p: Plants containing essential oils have been used for centuries as spices, remedies or for their pleasant odor. In the Middle Ages, the development of distillation techniques made it possible to obtain essential oils, which have continued to be used in their historical applications in food, medicine or cosmetics [ 1]. However, over the last few decades, the essential oil sector has entered a new dimension, as its fields of application are constantly increasing, largely due to the biocidal properties of its constituents.
